intro: Tetraena longicapsularis, commonly known as the long-capsule tetraena, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers, which are typically fragrant and attract various pollinators. Its fruit is a woody capsule that remains on the plant for an extended period, contributing to its ornamental value. Tetraena longicapsularis is adapted to dry, sunny conditions and is often found in coastal or sandy soils.
